net.sf.rcer.conn.connections
Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.rcer.conn.connections.ConnectionManager

public class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object

The central manager for all active connections to the SAP R/3 systems. Note that at any given time, zero, one or many connections may be active. The first connection that is activated becomes the so-called primary connection. The primary connection can be changed using ConnectionManager#s. If the primary connection is closed, any of the secondary connections becomes the new primary connection.

Author:
vwegert

getDestination

public com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination getDestination()
                                               throws ConnectionException,
                                                      com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException
Obtains the primary connection. If no connection is active, this method tries to deduce the connection to open: If the ConnectionRegistry only contains one connection, this connection is activated using an ICredentialsProviderWithoutSelection. If the ConnectionRegistry contains more than one connection, an ICredentialsProviderWithSelection is used to determine which connection to activate.

Returns:
the primary connection
Throws:
ConnectionException
com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException
See Also:
closeConnection(), #setPrimaryDestination(String)

getDestination

public com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination getDestination(IConnectionData connectionData,
                                                      boolean reuseConnection)
                                               throws com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException,
                                                      ConnectionException
Obtains the connection designated by the connection data. Reuses an existing connection if reuseConnection is set, forces the creation of a new connection otherwise. If no connection for the connection data ID is active, a new connection is activated. If it is the first connection that is activated, it automatically becomes the primary connection. Note that more than one connection may be active for a set of connection data - if this is the case, any of the connections is chosen arbitrarily.

Parameters:
connectionData -
reuseConnection - if true, an existing connection is reused
Returns:
the connection
Throws:
com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException
ConnectionException

getDestination

public com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination getDestination(java.lang.String connectionID,
                                                      boolean reuseConnection)
                                               throws ConnectionException,
                                                      com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException,
                                                      ConnectionNotFoundException,
                                                      ProviderNotFoundException
Obtains the connection designated. If the connection is not active, it is activated. If the connection is active and reuseConnection is true, the active conneciton is returned. Otherwise a new connection is opened

Parameters:
connectionID -
reuseConnection - if true, an existing connection is reused
Returns:
the connection
Throws:
ConnectionException
com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException
ProviderNotFoundException
ConnectionNotFoundException

                                                      com.sap.conn.jco.JCoException,

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()
Closes the primary connection. If no connection is active, nothing happens. If more than one connection is active, the primary connection is closed and any of the secondary connections becomes the new primary connection.

closeConnection

public void closeConnection(com.sap.conn.jco.JCoDestination destination)
Closes the designated connection. If the connection is not active, nothing happens. If more than one connection is active and the designated connection is the primary connection, it is closed and any of the secondary connections becomes the new primary connection.

Parameters:
destination -

closeConnection

public void closeConnection(IConnection connection)

connection -
